QA - Fuel System Function Checklist: Bulk Tanks
Template Name: QA - Fuel System Function Checklist: Bulk Tanks

name: Check the manual operation of the fuel pumps.
Fill the Bulk tank and check the fuel level reading of the level indicator with the dip stick
Check the pump stops, once the fuel level reaches 90%
Force the pump operation till the level reaches 95%, check the Hi-Level alarm is triggered at MCC
Force the pump operation and check the return flow into the bulk tank, the return flow should be greater than the fuel
supply to the tank. Do necessary adjustments if required.
Drain the tank and check the fuel pump starts at 50%.
Stop the pump manually and keep draining the tank, check the low level alarm is triggered at 40% at MCC
Keep draining the tank, check the Low-low level alarm is triggered at 10% and at MCC
Check the Solenoid valve operates correctly and the indicator on the MCC HMI is ON when the solenoid is open.
While the pump is running, press the E-Stop and check the pump stops
Simulate the Admin tank leak detector and check the alarm is raised at MCC
QA - Fuel System Function Checklist: Common Equipment
Template Name: QA - Fuel System Function Checklist: Common Equipment

name: Compare the level indicator readings of the fuel fill control panel (FFCP) with the bulk tank dip stick and do necessary adjustments in the level indicator setup to match with the actual reading
Simulate the Hi-Level alarm of the bulk tank and check the FFCP buzzer is triggered
Compare the level indicator readings of the Main fuel control panel with the FFCP and do necessary adjustments in the level indicator setup to match with the actual reading
Simulate the low level of the bulk tank and check the signal is alarm is triggered at the MCC
Simulate the bulk tank leak detector and check the alarm is triggered at MCC
Check the fuel polishing pump operation #1
Check the fuel polishing pump operation #2
Simulate the fuel pump #1 Flow meter fault and check the alarm is triggered at MCC
Simulate the fuel pump #2 Flow meter fault and check the alarm is triggered at MCC
Simulate the fuel pump #3 Flow meter fault and check the alarm is triggered at MCC
Simulate the fuel pump #4 Flow meter fault and check the alarm is triggered at MCC
Simulate the fuel pump #5 Flow meter fault and check the alarm is triggered at MCC
Simulate the fuel pump #6 Flow meter fault and check the alarm is triggered at MCC
Simulate the fuel pump #7 Flow meter fault and check the alarm is triggered at MCC
Simulate the fuel pump #8 Flow meter fault and check the alarm is triggered at MCC
Simulate the fuel polishing Flow meter fault and check the alarm is triggered at MFCP
Simulate fuel water separator detector and check the alarm is triggered at MCC
Simulate the fuel pump #1 fault and check the alarm is raised at MCC
Simulate the fuel pump #2 fault and check the alarm is raised at MCC
Simulate the fuel pump #3 fault and check the alarm is raised at MCC
Simulate the fuel pump #4 fault and check the alarm is raised at MCC
Simulate the fuel pump #5 fault and check the alarm is raised at MCC
Simulate the fuel pump #6 fault and check the alarm is raised at MCC
Simulate the fuel pump #7 fault and check the alarm is raised at MCC
Simulate the fuel pump #8 fault and check the alarm is raised at MCC
Simulate the fuel Polishing pump fault and check the alarm is raised at MCC

Template Name: QA - Fuel System Function Checklist: Admin Tank

name: Check the manual operation of the fuel pumps.
Fill the Admin tank and check the fuel level reading of the level indicator with the dip stick
Check the pump stops, once the fuel level reaches 90%
Force the pump operation till the level reaches 95%, check the Hi-Level alarm is triggered at MCC
Force the pump operation and check the return flow into the bulk tank, the return flow should be greater than the fuel
supply to the tank. Do necessary adjustments if required.
Drain the tank and check the fuel pump starts at 50%.
Stop the pump manually and keep draining the tank, check the low level alarm is triggered at 40% at MCC
Keep draining the tank, check the Low-low level alarm is triggered at 10% and at MCC

While the pump is running, press the E-Stop and check the pump stops
